page.title: 04 LEISURE ACTIVITIES
page.content: Laurieston is a small country village with a village hall, where a variety of activities take place for children, e.g. village parties and badminton which are organised by the community. There is opportunity for sailing and swimming at the loch in the nearby town of Castle Douglas. Bicycles are used a lot in this area, both for transport and enjoyment. Bird watching is popular, both in gardens and in the countryside around the village, where buzzards, waterfowl, finches and tits are regularly seen. A few people enjoy horse riding. There is a play area with swings. Games such as tig, hide and seek, cops and robbers are popular for young children in the village. The local lochs are popular for fishing, canoeing, sailing and swimming.
